intro: Erythroxylum longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved erythroxylum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Erythroxylaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil, Peru, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into capsule fruits. It is often found in humid, lowland areas and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological significance in its native habitats.
